page.title: 17THE CUBS 22ND "B" SO.SHIELDS
page.content: I am a cub in the 22nd "B" Brownsea Hall pack. We now hold the cubs at West Park Community Centre from 6.00- 7.30 pm each Monday night. When everyone is there we make te grand howl. This is when we promise to do our best to Akela, the scout leader. Our leaders are Akela the wolf, Keego the fish, Kaa the snake and Sharda. The cub movement is based on the Jungle Book Story by Rudyard Kipling. To become a cub you have to learn four things: 1{The Cub Sign.}2{The {Grand Howl.}3{The Cub Scout Law and {Promise}4{The Jungle Book Story.}After you do these you are invested,and then do badge work. There are the{ {bronze,silver}and{gold}arrows. The further you go the harder it is. In our pack there are two "sixes" or groups. You join when you are 8 and it costs 25p a night.
